item.description: Originally published on ProAndroidDev Why build a DSL? Ever since first getting into Kotlin, I’ve known it has a few things that makes building domain-specific languages (DSLs) easier. I’ve read the mind-expanding type-safe builders guide for building a DSL for HTML, but until recently I hadn’t found a good use case for building a DSL of my own. My team at Zalando maintains server-driven UI libraries for Android & iOS that power completely dynamic screens such as home, brand homes, collections, and various landing pages in the Zalando fashion store apps.
